9199010FE0DF4914BE66787908332E69.description: use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts

428D071464464AC2A14DFA2EF5CF8732.description: begin to distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings

F93463453E2D473783DD586EFA6F13E5.description: identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful)

D1E0675B4B074DBCA62C107F2A078E74.description: demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms)

2E8C0DFE05BA448BB9F56DCEE74D4850.description: sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent

2FC3A2D3E82149FA8A89A4ACD5CF722E.description: explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings, with guidance and support from adults

0D99200A612147B9AA80A974D601A0E2.description: use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word

5679C1A60D1E4148A4C8F550F473B417.description: identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck)

410852D6E4D24B52AC9746F3E97121A6.description: determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content, with guidance and support

4423E29BE01147959ECB7C4592A09889.description: spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships

D441FAAEEC9246E994DE50629A5BA7DB.description: write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes)

41902A56BA35441D860ADC99AD84B996.description: capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I

16DF0B8DB69A4C94B3698E29320C173E.description: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing

52751D6C9C92478A825B9D277FE8F6EE.description: produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities

E7AB4D814F2E4B59B5FAC9245B1881A6.description: use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with)

B5410016CF1C4AD190180B43A6644AD4.description: understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how)

7E6FF35225074C78B13D27F7A6CD0574.description: form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes) when speaking

A7147798291B4541A7432EE285A4788A.description: use frequently occurring nouns and verbs

C7E8687343674ADDB18168819B47AB8B.description: print legibly all upper- and lowercase letters and first and last names

6D57BCA1548048218E84F1BB70150BA4.description: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking

1E677239487C48FA909D73D4FD2E5A25.description: speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly

0349D71A9A5B44BD859A15AB6EA4CF0D.description: create drawings to support or extend the description of people, places, things, and events

FEFFB59657754ADFBE8D1ACB0B371A34.description: provide additional detail orally with prompting and support

1DC8A5780E114E18BC6BC78A2B6CB034.description: provide details when describing people, places, things, and events

16DEE8473E7D4EEC9F93F5F022682252.description: ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood

27A271CA041B4E0DAB6E31D9E0F8DAB4.description: confirm understanding of written texts read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood

F933497046444465BD341B5A511F940F.description: continue conversations and revisit topics to contribute new ideas and questions

9E7B80C298B84BEAA5F168F1D00A22D0.description: take turns speaking and listening while respectfully agreeing or disagreeing about the topics and texts under discussion

345F684E46D44C189150D6761F1F09CC.description: participate in collaborative conversations with different partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups

0B38178ECFB14ADF90B644ED8C64CC76.description: produce writing that reflects the author's voice and perspective

A4FE534938704AE9ABE89AB0CFB5179E.description: in narrative writing, imagine or remember to include details in pictures and words about what is going on, who was there, how they felt, and the events that happened

9328E9A9E58A4A03987B1981A18B6295.description: in informational writing, include details that teach information by answering questions such as who, what, when, where, why, and how

545C85F7FB44464588A46D5E2F589A2A.description: in opinion writing, collect and provide information about the topic and the opinion for readers so that readers believe and understand the writer's feelings about the topic

7C8CAB40809E47C89F098C200939D910.description: expand and elaborate writing appropriate to the type of writing

F12BC436355740F39A8E43E2A1894F79.description: recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question, with guidance and support from adults

DFC9A585A2AF4E949B0065A7C79BD425.description: participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them), with guidance and support

0E4C0A49B1E74292A8AE7021160ACF71.description: use a variety of tools to produce and publish writing, including digital tools in collaboration with peers, with guidance and support from adults

16849B61AB56454A9FD27CF606488314.description: develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, drafting, revising, and editing, with guidance and support from peers and adults

F438F76C443A4108A671DA290EE7F188.description: create different types of narrative writing including true stories and fictional stories

A2B68A2035D14BF6990987C29F93E7E5.description: tell, draw, and write stories across pages

5EB23B644A7D458CB7187EE0DDDAA158.description: include pages for the beginning, middle, and end of a story

63C8A83459D9490192B5C1A09D37911B.description: include an end page that shows what happened last in the story

988B7DE2D7B44C3DB912B3F592A73DE4.description: organize events and pages in order in which the events happened

F64FB6D340F84226B2516FF05DBF6DB6.description: provide a beginning for the story

BE2570416FC54489B49D75395BC84CA2.description: use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or a short sequence of events

6AAA2E32E7FB48349F62CAC11829CE64.description: create different types of informational writing including all-about books and how-to books

46B2CE0BD0584502B5F80A6CDEDB3B6D.description: tell, draw, and write information across pages

2D39F4F956A9429D8681528684370619.description: write different information on a topic across pages

F00937C732434A02BC34E32ECCAD694C.description: provide a beginning that states the topic

0E9B107023044FEBA0336E3AD15EB855.description: use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts

E38DC33D80594FBEB91446DB6A5D5A42.description: create different types of writing including signs, speeches, posters, how-to books, or letters

60B89023521D414C95DCBDB471082EA7.description: tell, draw, and write information across pages

997C86FF184B4BBCAA8150C6C3845BC6.description: share an opinion and state why the opinion was chosen

6E29322C92BF4039BC0ABE9F101D4D0B.description: provide a possible solution that is opinion-oriented

C1D18880F9464D0BB68C8F7B2A263C1E.description: use transition words such as 'because' to say more about a topic

8629549ADEC547CAAE1A4A4D6C2D8A64.description: provide a beginning that shares likes and dislikes about a topic

62FF0F4F6B834A7D88E9E8A431044AB5.description: use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces

449D864FF56E4A3682FB29200D99D3CA.description: read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does)

A0A88F39AA0346FD96F23384A49208FB.description: read emergent-reader texts, with purpose and understanding

048F55FEE4214CDA9D87E73E05229D0E.description: distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ

87016871594540D0837B9E40767B0715.description: demonstrate basic knowledge of long and short sounds for the five major vowels

3BA5586309164E3AAC342E4C078B2A9D.description: demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences for each consonant

036C0B70EECA4D54820764A90D569151.description: know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words

ECFC8656ED1542DC8CF77489F0B71A3B.description: add, substitute, or delete individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words

391D6227004949E4A55CD2054FB9B776.description: isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

5130A5994CE6466E9A25F154CC698D55.description: blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words

7E4D0B50DA7B4A4495245F0B80D008EC.description: count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words

87027CD60A654EFE8F0E7E837D5B42AF.description: demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes)

F84DA84C6B284EBFB3DE003845220EEC.description: name and match all upper-and lowercase letters of the alphabet out of sequence

546BFC26B0FA4D6BBF70D2F2FA688728.description: understand that words are separated by spaces in print

19B29D66B4344059B615E71951792D94.description: recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters

7947CE4F550D4FD2B7170E84D044FC56.description: follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page-by-page

18BD071EAF0243CDA56EC38BA8630D93.description: demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print

FC02109988B442CCA15CC612A4A13D1F.description: read and comprehend informational text of appropriate complexity for kindergarten, with prompting and support

8880528EF58C4CE796FEB4D7BC28FF4D.description: compare and contrast similarities and differences between two texts on the same topic, using examples from the texts, with prompting and support

B577CEF7FECF435ABB830FA35893E368.description: identify reasons an author gives to support points in a text, with prompting and support

A4DE46FE329744A8A0F8050863230DA9.description: describe how illustrations or photographs support the informational text, with prompting and support

D1116B11DDBD4EE8AE6D74402A2F6B69.description: name the author and illustrator/photographer of a text and define the role and purpose of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text, with prompting and support

F65F437478E044DC81032FFA59632A31.description: identify the text features in a text and explain the information each feature provides

EC672A151FA446A4A4463A1570B6B0ED.description: ask and answer questions about unknown words in an informational text and explain how to determine the meaning of unknown words, with prompting and support

E95CF189038C4A6983102CAB4F19241C.description: identify and describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text, with prompting and support

A180F5A5FB2946BB8EF7360EF54134D2.description: identify the main topic and retell key details of a text in a logical order, with prompting and support

3E52618A9BDE4EBDA3012F562B838517.description: ask and answer questions about key details in a text, such as who, what, where, when, why, and how, with prompting and support

854C39EB73174AB3B2F11A784C922290.description: recite short poems, rhymes, songs, and stories with repeated patterns

C26F6153553B471EA0D08D282018E993.description: read and comprehend literature, including stories and poems, of appropriate complexity for kindergarten, with prompting and support

E75196A90AF04E56A8B834DB9F99961E.description: compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of main characters in stories, with prompting and support

DD4197F2E538453590424CC9910CECA6.description: make predictions from illustrations and titles

92CCEB1959C14E47A7BCA95EF21F5B8F.description: tell stories using wordless picture books and picture sequences using familiar storybooks

C0E2913776BA4F5DAD5FCF9336966F37.description: use illustrations and details in the text to predict and to describe the characters, settings, or events, with prompting and support

94B483D06980478085EC9BA044157BAB.description: name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story, with prompting and support

569D312B271442BABFEA4EA0C918C579.description: recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, songs, poems, informational texts) and explain major differences between texts that tell stories and texts that give information

5A5E861A5D724179A6A89D7B7A98A478.description: ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text and explain how to determine the meaning of the unknown words, with prompting and support

417063E4A8E14B2D8C75E42342890380.description: describe main characters, settings, and major events in a story, with prompting and support

6F36F9C0F30341A6BF128544C8EDCF9A.description: retell stories in sequential order, including key details, with prompting and support

F55EF03EA58C4F1498E53CA6F7B54B0D.description: ask and answer questions about key details in a text, such as who, what, when where, why, and how, with prompting and support
